ComicIndex:
Comic Index
Peanuts
Charles M. Schulz
Line Drawing
Black and White
May 11, 1957
4 panel
One off gag
Panel 1 Set Up
Visual: Charlie Brown and Lucy walking and talking
Charlie Brown: "People come, and people go, but the earth just keeps on spinning."
Panel 2 Build Up
Charlie Brown and Lucy leaning on wall and talking
Lucy: " “Spinning”? What do you mean “spinning”?"
Charlie Brown: "Spinning through space…The earth keeps on spinning through space…"
Panel 3 Build Up
Lucy laughing loudly and Charlie Brown confused at her reaction
Lucy: "HA HA HA HA HA!!!"
Charlie Brown: "?"
Panel 4 Punchline and Reaction
Lucy continuing to laugh, leaning on Charlie Brown
Lucy: "Oh, my, Charlie Brown! You may not be the brightest person in the world, but you sure have some imagination!"
Charlie Brown: "Good grief!"
For Better or For Worse
Lynn Johnston
Line Drawing
Color
May 28, 2018
4 panel
One Off Gag
Panel 1 Set Up
Panel 1 Visual Michael Patterson slamming door
Panel 1 Dialogue non-verbal. Door “Slam!”
Panel 2 Build up
Panel 2 Visual Elly Patterson making school lunch, reacting to loud noises with startle
Panel 2 Dialogue non-verbal “Slam!” “Wham!” “Bang!” from out of frame
Panel 3 Build up
Panel 3 Visual Elly Patterson watching door slam as Michael exits house.
Panel 3 Dialogue non-verbal “Slam!”
Panel 4 Punchline/Denouement
Panel 4 Visual Michael Patterson walking away from home, looking cross/surly with Elly calling out to him
Panel 4 Dialogue Elly: “A little testy this morning, are we?!!”
Nancy Classics
Ernie Bushmiller
Line Drawing
Black and white
December 2, 1955
4 panel
One off gag
Panel 1 Set up
Panel 1 visual Aunt Fritzi Ritz giving Nancy a cookie jar, Nancy smiling
Panel 1 dialogue Aunt Fritzi: Nancy—“I bought you a whole jar of cookies all for yourself”
Panel 2 build up
Panel 2 visual Aunt Fritzi watching Nancy stare at cookie jar
Aunt Fritzi: “That’s odd—She’s not eating them.
Panel 3 build up
Nancy walking with cooking jar
None
Panel 4 Punchline
Panel 4 Visual Nancy standing on top of stool on top of box on top of chair reaching into cookie jar on top of bookshelf. Aunt Fritzi slightly surprised (raised eyebrows)
Panel 4 Dialogue Nancy: “I enjoy them more this way”
Spiderman
Stan Lee and Larry Lieber
Line Drawing
Color
November 30, 1980
4 panel
Serial
Panel 1 set up
Panel 1 Visual Spiderman talking to bank teller in a bank
Bank Teller: “ Any identification?”
Spiderman: “Look at my costume! Who do you think I am?!!”
Bank Teller: “Anyone can rent a costume!”
Panel 2 build up
Panel 2 visual Spiderman at teller’s window in bank lobby
Bank Teller: “Driver’s license? Social security?”
Spiderman: “Look I’ve a secret identity! I can’t blow my cover!”
Panel 3 Punchline
Bank Teller speaking to Spiderman with line of impatient bank customers faces in background
Bank Teller: “And we can’t cash just any old check!”
Bank Teller: “And you’re holding up the line!”
Panel 4 reaction and hook/lead-in
Panel 4 visual Spiderman sitting clinging to a wall with mask off and staring at his uncashed check
Spiderman: “I finally get $2000—and I can’t cash the check!”
Spiderman: “O.K. ! There’s only one thing left to do!”
Editorial: Lead In: “Next: The Breaking Point!”
